required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of TBS in Treatment Resistant Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of an Intensive and Spaced Treatment Protocol of Theta Burst Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation in Treatment Resistant Depression: a Randomized Double-blinded Placebo-controlled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Investigacion Sanitaria La Fe

collaborator.agency: Spanish Agency of Medicines and Health Products

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Investigacion Sanitaria La Fe

brief_summary.textblock: Theta Burst Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TBS) in dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) has showed efficacy and safety as an adjuvant strategy for resistant treatment depression in daily sessions during 4-6 weeks (20-30 sessions). Current investigation in TBS aims to design intensive treatment protocols so as to achieve earlier responses and higher rates of efficacy. However, the implementation of TBS in the Public National Health Service requires cost-effective protocols that ensure and facilitate patients adherence to treatment. The aim of this trial is to compare the efficacy of a bilateral intensive and spaced protocol of TBS with a unilateral one and sham stimulation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will receive 22 bilateral sessions of sham/active continuous (right DLPFC) and intermittent (left DLPFC) TBS during 6 weeks.
- Weeks 1 and 2: 1 session 5 days a week (10 sessions)
- Weeks 3,4,5, 6: 1 session 3 days a week (12 sessions)

primary_outcome.measure: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale 17 items (HDRS-17) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) respect to basal.
Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) respect to basal.
Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.
Altman Self Rating Mania Scale (ASRM) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.
Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI) respect to basal.
Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A) respect to basal.
Oviedo Sleep Questionnaire (OSQ) respect to basal.
Dimensional Apathy Scale (DAS) respect to basal
Screening for Cognitive Impairment por Psychiatry (SCIP) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.
Short Form Health Survey (SF 36) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.
Functional Assessment Short Test (FAST) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.
Global assessment of Functioning (GAF) at the end of the treatment respect to basal.

arm_group.description: 32 patients, bilateral active TBS stimulation, Will receive an intensive-spaced protocol Intermittent TBS in left DLPFC and Continuous TBS in right DLPFC
32 patients, unilateral left DLPFC active TBS stimulation. Will receive an intensive-spaced protocol Intermittent TBS in left DLPFC and Sham Continuous TBS in right DLPFC
32 patients, bilateral sham TBS stimulation. Will receive an intensive-spaced protocol of Sham Intermittent TBS in left DLPFC and Sham Continuous TBS in right DLPFC

intervention.intervention_name: Theta Burst Transcranial Magnetic Bilateral Stimulation
intervention.description: TMS protocol of 22 sessions of bilateral active 1800 pulses.

intervention.intervention_name: Theta Burst Transcranial Magnetic Sham Stimulation
intervention.description: TMS protocol of 22 sessions of sham bilateral 1800 pulses.

intervention.intervention_name: Theta Burst Transcranial Magnetic Unilateral Stimulation
intervention.description: TMS protocol of 22 sessions of left active 1800 pulses and right sham 1800 pulses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Major Depressive Episode or Depressive phase in Bipolar Disorder DSM-5 criteria.
- Moderate severity (>14 points in HDRS)
- 2 antidepressant failures or failure in enhancing strategies in the case of bipolar depression.
- No changes in treatment 3 week previous to the onset of treatment with TMS.
- Ability to sign informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any psychiatric comorbidity in axis I or II.
- Depressive episode with psychotic features.
- Dysthymia.
- Treatment with ECT in current depressive episode.
- Multiresistance (> 6 trials of therapeutic strategies).
- Suicide risk assessed previous to each session.
- Patients who missed 2 TMS sessions in a row
- Neurological comorbidities (epilepsy, Parkinson disease, neurocognitive disorders).
- Contraindications to TMS: pregnancy, metallic cervical or head implants.

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria La Fe

facility.name: Hospital Universitario y Politécnico La Fe

reference.citation: Blumberger DM, Vila-Rodriguez F, Thorpe KE, Feffer K, Noda Y, Giacobbe P, Knyahnytska Y, Kennedy SH, Lam RW, Daskalakis ZJ, Downar J. Effectiveness of theta burst versus high-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation in patients with depression (THREE-D): a randomised non-inferiority trial. Lancet. 2018 Apr 28;391(10131):1683-1692. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(18)30295-2. Epub 2018 Apr 26. Erratum in: Lancet. 2018 Jun 23;391(10139):e24.
